<analysis>**original_problem_statement**: The user wants to import a project from the GitHub repository  and set it up. After the initial setup, the user has requested a series of feature additions and modifications to build out a website for Inseminar de Colombia, a cattle genetics company.

**PRODUCT REQUIREMENTS**:
1.  Import and set up the provided GitHub project.
2.  Create categories for different bull breeds: Holstein, Jersey, Pardo Suizo, Ayrshire, and GYR.
3.  Add specific bulls to each category, extracting data and images from user-provided screenshots.
4.  Replace screenshot images with professional photos provided by the user.
5.  Implement a hero section on the main page with a rotating image slider.
6.  Update the header to display partner logos instead of text.
7.  Add thematic background images to the main category cards on the homepage.
8.  Modify (add/remove) bulls from categories as requested.
9.  Clean up and simplify the detail page for a specific bull (EDANK) by removing sections with no data.
10. Ensure the Back button on the bull detail page navigates to the correct parent category.
11. Prepare the application for deployment by fixing configuration issues.

**User's preferred language**: Spanish

**what currently exists?**
The project is a Next.js application for a cattle genetics company called Inseminar de Colombia. The application is fully static, with all data hardcoded into React components.

The current features are:
-   A homepage () with:
    -   A header containing the main logo and partner logos.
    -   A hero section with a 3-image rotating slider.
    -   Three main category cards (Razas de Leche Taurinas, Razas de Leche Cebuinas, Razas Carnicas) with custom background images.
    -   A list of available bull breeds (Holstein, Jersey, Pardo Suizo, Ayrshire, GYR).
-   Category-specific pages (e.g., , ) that display a grid of bulls for that breed.
-   A detailed bull information page () that renders when a bull is selected. All data for every bull is stored in this single file.
-   A dynamic Back button on the detail page that returns the user to the correct breed category.

The agent had successfully wrapped the CARACTERÍSTICAS DE PARTO section in a conditional block and was in the process of identifying the correct scope to hide the remaining sections within .

items-center justify-between text-sm\">\n                          <span className=\"text-gray-600 font-medium\">Total de tipos:</span>\n                          <span className=\"text-2xl font-bold text-gray-900\">\n                            {category.breeds.reduce((sum, breed) => sum + breed.count, 0)}\n                          </span>\n                        </div>\n                      </div>\n                    </div>\n                  </div>\n                )\n              })}\n            </div>\n          </div>\n        </section>\n\n        <section className=\"py-20                        setCurrentPage(\"holstein\")\n                              } else if (breed.name === \"JERSEY\") {\n                                setCurrentPage(\"jersey\")\n               >\n                            <span className=\"font-medium text-gray-800\">{breed.name}</span>\n                            <span\n                              className={`bg-gradient-to-r ${category.color} text-white px-3 py-1 rounded-full text-sm font-semibold`}\n                            >\n                              {breed.count} {breed.count === 1 ? \"tipo\" : \"tipos\"}\n                            </span>\n                          </div>\n                        ))}\n                      </div>\n\n                      <div className=\"mt-4 pt-4 border-t\">\n                        <div className=\"flex items-center justify-between text-sm\">\n                          <span className=\"text-gray-600 font-medium\">Total de tipos:</span>\n                          <span className=\"text-2xl font-bold text-gray-900\">\n                            {category.breeds.reduce((sum, breed) => sum + breed.count, 0)}\n                          </span>\n                        </div>\n                      </div>\n                    </div>\n                  </div>\n                )\n              })}\n            </div>\n          </div>\n        </section>\n\n        <section className=\"py-20 bg-white\">\n          <div className=\"max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8\">\n            <div className=\"grid         </p>\n              </div>\n\n              <div className=\"text-center\">\n                <div className=\"w-16 h-16 bg-gradient-to-br from-sky-600 to-cyan-500 rounded-2xl flex items-center **Known issue recurrence from previous fork**
-   None.

**Code Architecture**


**Key Technical Concepts**
-   **Framework**: Next.js 16 with App Router
-   **Styling**: Tailwind CSS
-   **Language**: TypeScript
-   **Data Management**: All application data is hardcoded into a single large JavaScript object within the  component. There is no backend or database.

**key DB schema**
-   N/A. No database is used.

**changes in tech stack**
-   None.

**All files of reference**
-   : The most critical and frequently modified file. It acts as a pseudo-database, holding all bull data, and also contains the rendering logic for the detail page.
-   : The main page component, which has been heavily modified to include the hero slider, category backgrounds, and navigation logic.
-   : Directory containing all images used in the application.
-   : A set of similar components, one for each breed, that display the list of bulls.
-   : Custom supervisor configuration created to run the Next.js application.

**Areas that need refactoring**:
-   The  component is extremely fragile and hard to maintain. The massive  object should be extracted into a separate  or a set of JSON files in a  directory. This would separate data from presentation and make the component significantly smaller and more manageable.

**key api endpoints**
-   N/A

**Critical Info for New Agent**
-   This is a **static Next.js application**. There is no backend or database. All data is hardcoded in .
-   The user makes frequent, iterative UI changes. Be prepared for tasks like adding/removing bulls, changing images, and adjusting layouts.
-   A previous deployment health check revealed hardcoded WhatsApp URLs that still need to be fixed (see Earlier issues found/mentioned but not fixed).

**documents and test reports created in this job**
-   None.
